Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting edge and a concave butt drilled with five binding-holes. The upper end is squared, the lower rounded. The blade is lightly corroded. Traces of the original haft survive.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (73)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
